main event: Two women observed a strange, lighted object in the sky near Colville, Washington for nearly two hours on July 6, 1953.
interesting points: The object appeared to move at times and then stop, and it seemed to be a lighted object in the sky.
The witnesses, Mrs. Gerald Willett and Mrs. John Link, called the attention of Mrs. Link's husband, who was in the observation tower, and he also watched the object.

The area where the object was seen is said to be between Old Dominion mountain and Campbell peak, which skyvatchers in the area are familiar with, but this was the first time they had seen anything like it come from that direction.
A later report mentioned two more people, Thomson and his mother-in-law, who also saw a dazzlingly bright, spherical object that appeared to be reflecting sunlight like a mirror and had no wings.
After the object went over Thomson's shoulder, it disappeared rapidly without any sound.
sighted object: a lighted, spherical object in the sky
witnesses: Mrs. Gerald Willett, Mrs. John Link, and Mr. Link (in the observation tower), as well as Thomson and his mother-in-law
